bibl.title: Timosthenes and Eratosthenes: Sea Routes and Hellenistic Geography.
The Ptolemies, the Sea and the Nile. Studies in Waterborne Power.

bibl.note: In the same way as an interest in geography was promoted by the Ptolemaic kingdom so too cartography reflected the considerations of the Ptolemaic power.
bibl.seg: Francisco Prontera, Timosthenes and Eratosthenes: Sea Routes and Hellenistic Geography.
Kostas Buraselis, Mary Stefanou & Dorothy J. Thompson (edd.), The Ptolemies, the Sea and the Nile. Studies in Waterborne Power (Cambridge, 2013) pp. 207-217, 1 carte, 2 figg.
In the same way as an interest in geography was promoted by the Ptolemaic kingdom so too cartography reflected the considerations of the Ptolemaic power.
